WRITING.TEXT: Evil as a descriptive term rather than a noun or adjective because of its looming and dark out-of-place appearance, although some people believe that the power to bring people back from death is evil itself. So go figure #129320;
I #8217;ll miss you lt;\3 hole in the community, RIP
But why not catch them and relocate like snakes and crocs? Why make such a cult of it
I think it is a cult if you have to join an exclusive group, dress up in a certain outfit and blow on a horn. Even so we evolve, it #8217;s not like we are praising the sunrise anymore.

Not praising them, I just have respect for them. I can understand why farms raise them and kill them to be eaten or why people have pets. I just don #8217;t understand why anyone would want to ride a horse/camel/bull/pig/etc seems wrong
Yes but it has an endgame which is feeding people, where as riding has no real purpose
Not most abused but definitely most overlooked form of abuse to that point where it has become accepted
I mean is there any actual proof they don #8217;t mind being ridden? And people do ride pigs, is that somehow more cruel than a horse?
True, I didn #8217;t think of that! But still seems kinda bad :/
I suppose it is more of a rural practice but it happens. Horses do occasionally buck and I think they get trained/broken so young they #8220;learn #8221; not to though :/

WRITING.TITLE: Took this in the Amsterdam torture museum! My first ghost :D *completely unedited and ofc it had to be on a slightly blurry picture

WRITING.TEXT: Bottom of the stairs on the right!
Omg you did some edits on my photo! Thank you so much :D that #8217;s awesome! Above this photo was hanging cages and some blue lights, i #8217;ll also add this museum is very well lit :)
Yeah! I see it as like hunched up or crawling up the stairs! Was so happy when I saw this look back through my pics :D

WRITING.TITLE: Swapping from cutting to burning?
WRITING.TEXT: Heya, first time poster (F22) :) Couldn #8217;t find this against any of the rules so I #8217;ll just go ahead. I #8217;ve been self harming (cutting) for a few years now, on meds, seen therapist and such. Stop harming for a little while then relapse every so often. Recently I #8217;ve swapped from cutting to burning myself and I wanted to know and tips or tricks anybody has on care and cover? My burns aren #8217;t seriously bad but I suppose they are quite obviously self harm and are taking much longer to heal than cuts :/ Even if you have nothing to say thank you for listening and letting me vent xx
